main event: A civilian observer spotted an unidentified oval-shaped object that was rose-orange in color and hovering in the sky near St. Georges, Delaware on April 29, 1952.
interesting points: The object was seen for approximately 10 seconds and was traveling at an estimated speed of 100 mph.
The object made two complete turns during the sighting.
The observers used field glasses to watch the object, which was clearly visible and made no sound, left no vapor trail, but appeared to have a 'fire tail'.
The observers estimated the altitude of the object to be 'six inches from the ground'.
The observers were members of the Flying Saucer Investigative Associates, Inc.
